comment: Please take her for your Spanish classes! Her class was really easy and she seems very sweet. Most of the work is done through Connect, and the assignments are not long. Also, she was very easy to reach out to and replies fast.
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: She is so kind and helpful, and always available for questions! She also gives opportunities for assignment extensions and even let me redo an assignment I didn't understand. She grades fairly and is extremely respectful and just a wonderful person. Definitely recommend!

This is an easy class, yet you'll get much better at Spanish conversation. The only homework is the online textbook, and you get a full 100 as long as the final grade is at least 75. There are 3 oral exams and a final presentation which is pretty easy. In class you only talk, sometimes not even in Spanish. Just show up, try and she'll love you.

Just take this class. She's an awesome human being and cares about all of her students. If you're struggling, she'll help you get through it. You have 3 oral exams, homework due on the online textbook (pricey), and a final presentation and that's literally it. It's honestly not bad at all and all you do in class is talk to each other. Just take it.

Garcia was the best Spanish teacher I have taken at Kennesaw and out of the majority of 10 different teachers I have ever taken. She is so helpful and accommodating when she sees you really trying to improve. She gives so many free days to not come during oral exams that missing any the rest of the semester is inexcusable.

I absolutely adore Ms. Garcia. She is funny, kind, and a wonderful teacher. I learned so much and became much more fluent in Spanish taking this class. Study for the quizzes and the exams and you will do great. The project at the end will take some effort, but she is willing to help and answer questions. Take her!!

She's delightful to chat with and makes this class really fun--you'll learn about a lot of different topics and get more confident in your Spanish-speaking ability for sure. The tests are oral and are pretty challenging, but she helps you out if you're struggling to find your words. The class felt like a little family and it was great!

I CANNOT brag on Profesora Garcia enough. One of, if not THE best Spanish professor I have ever had. Took her for practical conversation so there were oral exams (which make me nervous) but she makes you feel comfortable and relaxed and helps you through them. Such an encouraging, sweet professor and hilarious, too!

TAKE HER! Shes the sweetest, funniest, sassiest little woman and I loved it. She cares about and has a special connection with students. Half the class is spent just sharing opinions about topics using tenses we learned. Homework, quizzes, 3 oral exams and a presentation. I did the hwk the morning of and studied for quizzes in the class before.
One of my favorite teachers. 3 oral exams, 2 quizzes and a presentation for the final. Getting a 100 on the oral exams is very easy, you're given the questions that will be asked ahead of time.

Great professor! One of my favorites in the spanish department. Really cares about her students. I found this class to be super easy, but beware of the online homework. Speaking exams are easy, but the quizzes required you to study. One big presentation at the end you really need to be prepared for, other than that, straightforward easy A class

Garcia REALLY cares about her students and wants to help you succeed. She has a great sense of humor, and she teaches you really practical stuff based on your future plans (if/where you plan on studying abroad.) The class isn't super easy, but it's because you're learning another language and that's never easy.

This particular class she teaches in Practical Conversation. Classes are structured around conversation based interactions. She assigns VHL homework every Tuesday and Thursday. Pretty easy. In class discussions are based around homework questions. I didnt show up to half of classes and I got an A. BUT I also already have a Spanish background.

This woman is amazing. Absolutely amazing. She gets very upset when you speak in English in her conversation classes though. The conversation class is overall pretty chill. Pretty much anything is fair game, but you'll discuss it in Spanish. In a conversation class it's an effective way to learn. Not an easy class, but worth it.

I loved her class! She is definitely scatterbrained but sometimes those are the best teachers! We definitely were expected to talk in this class. If you spoke in English she would cover her ears and say "LaLaLa No entiendo ingles!" so we had to speak in spanish. She isn't great on giving directions but shes an amazing professsor!

Prof. Garcia is extremely scatter-brained and unorganized BUT I'm happy that I took her class. She KNOWS that she is all of the above, and therefore, is very understanding and willing to help you out. She was patient with those not up to speed in Spanish, and assignments were simple. Her class was a mystery every single day, but an A is attainable!

PROF. GARCIA IS A GOOD TEACHER AND IS WILLING TO HELP IN THE LOWER LEVEL CLASSES. YES SHE DOES TAKE A WHILE TO RESPOND BACK TO EMAILS BUT SHE IS AN EASY A. DO YOUR WORK AND PUT IN THE EFFORT AND SHE WILL GIVE YOU THE GRADE YOU DESERVE,
You have to work for your grade, but she is very helpful if you show effort. She makes the class fun and interesting. Recommend.

I did not enjoy this class at all.  She is incredibly disorganized and her assignments are unclear.  I did make an A in this class probably because she liked me but this was not a Conversation class.  She is a bad professor and never responds in a timely manner.  She should stick to teaching lower level Spanish.  I learned nothing in her class.

This class was note conversational Spanish! We had to buy the online code for homework purposes but it was BARELY used. Barely spoke in class instead watched movies. She should stick to teaching lower level Spanish classes.Oh yeah and guideline for our presentation/paper were super vague.Everyone was on VISTA trying to figure out what was going on

I love Prof Garcia! She is a great teacher! She is very blunt and straightforward but not in a rude way. She stongly encourages you to speak Spanish when you speak which in turn helps you out and it's fun because she just wants you to spit it out.She doesn't get hung up on your wrong usage of tenses.That makes it easier and less stressful as well.

She is great. I learned a lot from her and she was always helpful. Some students don't seem to like her because she is very upfront and honest. She will tell you as it is but if you show interest in her class she will go the extra mile to help you

How this woman has so many positive reviews is beyond me.  Her English is not near as good as she thinks it is, her past tense is terrible.  Take her course if you want to hear her lecture on her political views all semester and hear her ramble about how evil big business is and how it causes Latin American countries to remain oppressed.
Great teacher.  I learned a great deal.  She's no the most understanding person about some things while very liberal about others.  She does a good job and cares.

I absolutely loved her class! She has a great personality and is an interesting story teller.  She spoke mostly in Spanish, which is necessary at this level, and she encouraged us to respond.  She is disorganized, but who cares?

She is by far the worst professor I have ever had! She never knows what is going on, hardly ever follows the syllabus (thus, her students don't know what is going on either) or changes it randomly, and my favorite assignment (heard it many times this year) is "bring your stuff." What is "stuff"? She hardly talks in Spanish and this is a 3000 level!

very interesting class, she's always a little disorganized but she knows that and doesn't take it out on you.she's also a little hard to contact.overall,she wants all students to do good,she remembers what it was like to be a student and will bend the rules for you if need be.laid back.good teacher!
Very approachable and willing to help you figure out grammar mistakes and translations.  Loved her!

WHAT?!? She doesn't care if you don't understand? WRONG! For me, her class was sooo boring because she coddled too much the ones that couldn't understand! She speaks more in English than she should at this level! Do your work and you'll make an A in this class. She wants you to have an A! EASY CLASS
One of the most interesting professors I've ever had. Very easy as long as you pull your weight.

multicultural communications-interesting and flexible.  As long as you read and participate you can get an A.  There is not that much to read.  The term paper/presentation was fun and easy. Tests are essay.
Wonderful teacher! Always helpful and great personality!
A little unfocused, but she's a good teacher.
Teaches only in Spanish, doesn't care if you don't catch on.  Confusing.
